benchmark_details.name: Cross-Lingual Transfer from Related Languages: Treating Low-Resource Maltese as Multilingual Code-Switching
benchmark_details.overview: We present a novel dataset annotated with word-level etymology to improve cross-lingual transfer capabilities for Maltese, a language influenced by Arabic, Italian, and English.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To improve the cross-lingual transfer capabilities of Maltese by selectively applying transliteration and translation based on word etymology.

data.source: Annotated dataset extracted from the Maltese Universal Dependencies Treebank consisting of 439 sentences and 9,683 tokens.
data.annotation: Annotated by experts with etymological tags based on language origin (Arabic, Non-Arabic, Mixed).

methodology.calculation: Performance evaluated using fine-tuning on language models and measuring accuracy and F1 scores on downstream tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better language model performance on specified NLP tasks using the newly annotated dataset.
methodology.baseline_results: BERTu achieved a top-line accuracy of 98.3% on POS tagging.
methodology.validation: Cross-validation was performed using 10 folds to evaluate the reliability of the classifier.
